key.name: development-tools
key.summary: Enable internal tools useful for developers and testers from Alt-F2
key.description: Allows access to internal debugging and monitoring tools using the Alt-F2 dialog.

key.name: enabled-extensions
key.summary: Uuids of extensions to enable
key.description: Cinnamon extensions have a uuid property; this key lists extensions which should be loaded. disabled-extensions overrides this setting for extensions that appear in both lists.

key.name: panel-autohide
key.summary: Auto-hide panel
key.description: Whether the panel autohides or not.

key.name: menu-text
key.summary: Text for the menu
key.description: The text shown in the Menu label.

key.name: overview-corner-visible
key.summary: Enable or disable the overview corner icon
key.description: Whether the overview icon is visible or not.

key.name: overview-corner-hover
key.summary: Enable or disable the overview hot corner
key.description: Whether the overview hot corner is enabled or not.

key.name: panel-launchers
key.summary: Desktop files of the applications to put in the panel launchers applet
key.description: Cinnamon allows to show applications launchers on the panel. This key lists the desktop files of the applications to show there.

key.name: enable-app-monitoring
key.summary: Whether to collect stats about applications usage
key.description: Cinnamon normally monitors active applications in order to present the most used ones (e.g. in launchers). While this data will be kept private, you may want to disable this for privacy reasons. Please note that doing so won't remove already saved data.

key.name: favorite-apps
key.summary: List of desktop file IDs for favorite applications
key.description: The applications corresponding to these identifiers will be displayed in the favorites area.

key.name: disabled-open-search-providers
key.summary: disabled OpenSearch providers

key.name: command-history
key.summary: History for command (Alt-F2) dialog

key.name: looking-glass-history
key.summary: History for the looking glass dialog

key.name: name
key.summary: Theme name

key.name: show-weekdate
key.summary: Show the week date in the calendar
key.description: If true, display the ISO week date in the calendar.

key.name: keyboard-type
key.summary: Which keyboard to use
key.description: The type of keyboard to use.

key.name: show-seconds
key.summary: Show time with seconds
key.description: If true, display seconds in time.

key.name: show-date
key.summary: Show date in clock
key.description: If true, display date in the clock, in addition to time.

key.name: framerate
key.summary: Framerate used for recording screencasts.
key.description: The framerate of the resulting screencast recordered by Cinnamon's screencast recorder in frames-per-second.

key.name: pipeline
key.summary: The gstreamer pipeline used to encode the screencast
key.description: Sets the GStreamer pipeline used to encode recordings. It follows the syntax used for gst-launch. The pipeline should have an unconnected sink pad where the recorded video is recorded. It will normally have a unconnected source pad; output from that pad will be written into the output file. However the pipeline can also take care of its own output - this might be used to send the output to an icecast server via shout2send or similar. When unset or set to an empty value, the default pipeline will be used. This is currently 'videorate ! vp8enc quality=10 speed=2 threads=%T ! queue ! webmmux' and records to WEBM using the VP8 codec. %T is used as a placeholder for a guess at the optimal thread count on the system.

key.name: file-extension
key.summary: File extension used for storing the screencast
key.description: The filename for recorded screencasts will be a unique filename based on the current date, and use this extension. It should be changed when recording to a different container format.
